text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen if 
you've been following me on Facebook you know

that I've been playing around with my new 
ice cream machine and trying to work out a

good coconut ice cream recipe and today it 
is ready to share so I wanted to start out

my first ice cream episode with coconut ice cream 
because it's pretty much the only traditional ice

cream we have if you go to ice cream shops here 
you see a million and one different flavors you

go to Thailand the traditional sort of street card 
vendor ice cream vendors they'll only have coconut

ice cream and so that's why I wanted to start with 
this one so let's take a look at our ingredients

so if you've made ice cream before you will notice 
that that list of ingredients looks nothing like

your typical ingredient list for an ice cream 
there's no milk no cream no eggs none of that

and that's because in Thai cuisine we don't 
use any dairy products you may have noticed

that I've never used dairy products in any of my 
cooking except for in drinks and so the coconut

milk serves as the creamy component of this ice 
cream but still the end result is going to be more

like halfway between a sorbet and an ice cream 
it's not rich and creamy it's a little lighter

and icier much better for a hot and humid day 
actually so let's talk about the coconut water

just one thing I want to talk about before we go 
make our ice cream the coconut water you can get

from one of these coconuts okay or you can get 
one of the prepackaged ones but I want you to

be aware that the ones from a fresh coconut like 
this is a lot more fragrant and usually a little

bit sweeter if you get from a a prepackaged 
one you want to make sure that it's a hundred

percent coconut water there's no sugar added no 
the ingredient list should just say coconut water

and I mean if you can't find it and you get one 
that's sweetened you may have to mess with the

amount of sugar in this recipe a little bit so you 
just open it I'm not going to show you so this is

the one that I got my coconut water from and I'm 
not going to show you how to open this because I

am terrible at it and it's never pretty it's low 
ungraceful when I do it I call for a one and a

half cup of coconut water because about one and a 
half cup is in one of these so if you're short a

little bit just make up the difference in coconut 
milk it's not going to be too far off and there's

other YouTube videos you can watch for how to 
open these alright let's go and cook our ice

cream so I've got my coconut milk here sitting 
over flame and I'm this is so simple I'm just

gonna put everything in the pot going in with the 
palm sugar and I'm using palm sugar because palm

sugar has a really nice flavor if you use good 
quality palm sugar for this you don't actually

need to add any flavoring art extracts anything 
the coconut water and the palm sugar together

will make the ice cream very very aromatic and 
of course good quality coconut milks I always

use 100% coconut milk for this one if you can 
help it so I'm just going to cook this until

all the sugar is dissolved and then meanwhile 
you know might as well add everything else so

going in with the white sugar so there I'm not 
using all palm sugar because I want to make sure

the ice cream remains white so the palm sugar is 
going to make it a little bit off-white and also I

find that if there's too much palm sugar because 
it's got that butterscotchy kind of flavor too

much of it will make it a little richer than I 
like it to be it's not as light and refreshing

as I wanted it to be and then our salt just to 
brighten everything up and then at this point

I'm going to turn it off and then I am going to 
add in my coconut water one to help it cool down

faster too because I don't want to cook away any 
sort of the aroma of the coconut water I want to

make it as fresh as real as possible and then I 
was holding off on you there's one ingredient I

did not include in the ingredient list and that's 
that's because it's not entirely necessary about

two tablespoons of vodka and no it's not because 
I want to get drunk on it then it's not enough

that you can even taste it but I find it with my 
machine because it's just a home machine the ice

cream actually freezes very very hard when you 
when you put it in and if you've made sorbet

at home before you may have experienced this and 
the alcohol just helps prevent it from freezing to

hard because the alcohol doesn't freeze so you 
know a small amount dispersed in the ice cream

mixture will help scoop ability I mean by all 
means if you are using a more serious machine

you may not need it or if you already have your 
own tricks of how to make your in this case it's

closer to a sorbet how to make your sorbet more 
scoopable then by all means use those tricks that

you have and that's it we're just going to let 
it chill in the fridge we go and turn it so now

let's talk about the add-ins to our ice cream you 
don't have to add anything to the ice cream the

ice cream is perfectly delicious by itself but 
to make it a little more interesting I'm adding

two different things and that's jackfruit and 
young coconut meat now jackfruit first of all

is a ginormous fruit they go from anywhere between 
here to I've seen those biggest here and the flesh

inside is yellow just like these okay and there 
used to be a pit in the middle and now it's gone

and so this is canned I can't get fresh jackfruit 
here and so the can comes in form like this it's

got a very interesting flavor and smell if you've 
not had jackfruit before it might be a bit of an

acquired taste I would taste it first before 
committing your ice cream to it cut it into

little pieces and stir it and it's very common 
to find coconut ice cream with jackfruit in it

so the young coconut meat you can get it out 
of this if you using a fresh coconut you can

just get it I ate that part but there used to be 
coconut meat here but you can just take a spoon a

sharper spoon would be better and sort of scrape 
out the inside and then come on and then this is

kind of what you cut up and then add to your 
ice cream okay so you just do that or you're

not using one of these you can also use a canned 
one so a canned one is actually not that bad as

far as canned stuff goes this is pretty good it 
comes already cut into big pieces like this and

you could just take it and cut it up into small 
pieces and then add to your ice cream you can add

other things but I would recommend no more than 
half a cup total of total amount of things in

it because I've put 1 cup of stuff before and it 
was more like you know rather than ice cream with

stuff in it it was stopped with ice cream around 
it just holding it together and it was not very

good so whatever you decide to do no more than 
half a cup at this point just proceed according to

your machines instructions for making sorbet make 
sure your mixture is completely cooled before you

turn and for a good texture be careful enough 
to overturn it stop it when the mixture looks

like a thick milkshake freeze the ice cream 
in a shallow metal pan because it'll freeze

faster which will result in a smoother texture so 
before I bring out the ice cream fingers crossed

that it's going to be okay let's talk toppings 
there's lots of different toppings you can do

when you get a traditional coconut ice cream 
but I'm going to talk about my few favourite

ones that are easy for you to replicate first is 
the sticky rice the sweet sticky rice the same one

that I use for my mango and sticky rice so if 
you make a mango sticky rice you've got extra

rice left you can make the coconut ice cream and 
to use it up so just a little bit and the rice

when combined with the ice cream becomes kind 
of the chewy factor which you never get an ice

cream right so it's it's kind of fun and then 
on to go on top I've got roasted peanuts which

is also really super classic they almost put 
it on everyone you can also do the crispy mung

beans the same ones that I made for mango sticky 
rice as well finally the sandwich bread well it's

more like a hot dog bun hot dog buns are work 
better but you can get any sort of white bread

and then you put this all set up in it including 
the sticky rice and everything and you eat it kind

of like an ice cream burger and it's a longish 
out here because it's incredibly messy but it's

really good for those of you who are so inclined 
so let's bring out the ice cream so I'm rushing it

a bit it's pro it could probably use a little bit 
more time it's somewhat scoopable Hey oh how cute

I'm gonna go in with my peanuts also a little 
bit my own beans mixer crunch I'm so excited

food that would be important oh and also a lot 
of people like to drizzle evaporated milk on

this you can if you'd like not so good it 
really is halfway between a sorbet and ice

cream very coconutty in a refreshing way not 
in the rich curry way and I see enough anyway

here's iced coconut ice cream I hope you 
enjoyed please if you've got the setup to

make ice cream give it a chance and let me 
know how it turns out for you you can get

in touch with me through Facebook Twitter 
Instagram or write me a message through my

website hot pan kitchen calm and that is also 
where the recipe is going to be and if you do

the show please click to subscribe and I will 
see you next time for your next delicious time
you
